column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Inupiaq alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. month of April (lit. month of the geese)

intj
  1. listen, hark
  2. oops (used to acknowledge an error)
  3. oh (used to express surprise)

intj
  1. yes, I know
  2. I agree: expresses listener's agreement with storyteller or speaker
  3. expresses exasperation, criticism or dismay over what another person does or says, said in breathy voice
  4. expression of surprise or awe

det
  1. across there [visible, covering a large area or in motion]

adv
  1. in the distant memorable past, long ago

noun
  1. its underside, ventral area, the area under something

noun
  1. a pain that does not go away immediately

det
  1. the one across there [visible, in a limited area or not in motion]

pron
  1. all of it or the whole thing

det
  1. across there (visible, in a limited area or not in motion)

noun
  1. person who is born in the same year as self or others

noun
  1. large whale with rolled blubber on the back

noun
  1. a path cut through bush or trees

noun
  1. warning, that which has been told, a message of forewarning

adv
  1. this one [boat, river, train, airplane, area without confines, or a person who is not aware of activity around him, lengthy or in motion, visible]

noun
  1. lightsource, source of light
  2. naniq: A traditional oil lamp of the Inupiat

noun
  1. a camping pack, backpack as of canvas, nylon or sealskin
  2. a packsack

noun
  1. alder tree, alder bark
  2. rust-colored dye from alder bark

det
  1. up there above (and behind speaker), away from shore, landwards, mountainwards (visible, in motion or covers a large area)

det
  1. that one up there on the roof (not visible)

adv
  1. located back there in an area (not visible)

adv
  1. located back there [in a large visible area]

noun
  1. one of the long vertebra near neck

adv
  1. before it, in the past, before this time
  2. in front of it

noun
  1. Bohemian waxwing bird (lit. with pretty wing feathers)

noun
  1. any berry inedible for humans, e.g. juniper berry, soapberry, highbush cranberry

adv
  1. on a person's back; at the back of

adv
  1. this one [e.g. box, chair, confined area or person who is aware of activity around him not in motion, visible]
